title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement phgrosjean@sciviews.org. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: chart To Do list
text: autoplot() plot() methods (+ hist(), etc.) autoplot(), chart() methods lmer objects Implement .DollarNames() get list chart() types available, mechanism add types additional packages. Refine themes look themes {lattice} base. Use labels base {lattice} plots.

title: Unified Interface (with Formula) for R Plots
text: R, several plotting engines, three major ones base {graphics} package (called “base plot”), {lattice} {ggplot2}. philosophy syntax. plots produce distinctive look, even can tailored different styles. {chart} package provides unified interface three plotting engines. goal {chart} : provide unified interface three major plotting engines R; make three types plots compatible composite figure; propose default style plots consistent across three engines close enough publication-ready style; use automatically labels units axes, possible; expose formula-base interface alternative {ggplot2} users; implement various (customizable) plot types different R objects.

title: Unified Interface (with Formula) for R Plots
text: {chart} package uses {ggplot2} priority. designed close possible {ggplot2} syntax following four exceptions: use chart() instead ggplot(). chat() function backward compatible ggplot() can use syntax, also uses alternate formula-based interface. contrary ggplot(), chart() automatically use labels units axes legends, uses default style closer “publication-ready” format, generic function provides different methods (different plot types method). can use formula instead aes() specify aesthetics.

title: Why Chart?
text: Since formula interface used extensively R specify models, little bit strange corresponding plots {ggplot2} must specified totally different way. {chart} package allows specify “aesthetics” familiar formula interface. instance, simple model: model specified Volume ~ Girth, must translated aes(x = Girth, y = Volume) {ggplot2}. common pitfall beginners invert X Y appear different order interfaces.  {chart}, can use formula interface directly:  course, necessarily formula used model chart. formula interface different meaning, depending function uses . specify aesthetics {chart} just x y, use %arg=% terms. instance, specify color points, use %col=%:
code: data(trees) trees_lm <- lm(Volume ~ Girth, data = trees) summary(trees_lm) #>  #> Call: #> lm(formula = Volume ~ Girth, data = trees) #>  #> Residuals: #>    Min     1Q Median     3Q    Max  #> -8.065 -3.107  0.152  3.495  9.587  #>  #> Coefficients: #>             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)     #> (Intercept) -36.9435     3.3651  -10.98 7.62e-12 *** #> Girth         5.0659     0.2474   20.48  < 2e-16 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> Residual standard error: 4.252 on 29 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared:  0.9353, Adjusted R-squared:  0.9331  #> F-statistic: 419.4 on 1 and 29 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16 library(ggplot2) ggplot(trees, aes(x = Girth, y = Volume)) +   geom_point() +   geom_smooth(method = "lm", formula = 'y ~ x') library(chart) chart(trees, Volume ~ Girth) +   geom_point() +   geom_smooth(method = "lm", formula = 'y ~ x') chart(trees, Volume ~ Girth %col=% Height) +   geom_point()

title: Why Chart?
text: contrary ggplot(), chart() generic. means specify data frame data =, can provide object chart(), autoplot() methods defined. many methods defined {chart} package . method function objects create base R plots, converted {chart} compatible objects:  {chart} package designed basic framework implement several methods different R objects. uses “subsettable type” semantic, , type = argument can define different plots object class, , calling chart$<type>(....) produces given type plot object. TODO: make short example . See packages like {modelit} {exploreit} several examples methods.
code: chart(function() {   plot(Volume ~ Girth, data = trees, pch = 19, col = "black")   grid(lty = "solid") })

title: Why Chart?
text: Another aspect chart() tailored produce plots close possible publication-ready (. remain fully editable {ggplot2} functions, course). Hence, default theme, labels axes legends set accordingly. data frame label units attributes defined variables, used construct labels axes legends. example trees dataset:
code: trees <- data.io::labelise(trees, label = list(     Volume = "Volume of timber",     Girth  = "Diameter at 1.4m",     Height = "Height"   ), units = list(     Volume = "cubic feet",     Girth  = "inches",     Height = "feet")) chart(trees, Volume ~ Girth %col=% Height) +   geom_point()

text: Philippe Grosjean. Author, maintainer.

code: @Manual{,   title = {SciViews::R},   author = {Philippe Grosjean and Guyliann Engels},   organization = {UMONS},   address = {MONS, Belgium},   year = {2024},   url = {https://sciviews.r-universe.dev/}, }

title: Unified Interface (with Formula) for R Plots
text: {chart} available CRAN yet. install SciViews R-Universe. {data.io} package useful manages labels units {chart} uses. install two packages dependencies, run following command R: can also install latest development version {chart}. Make sure {remotes} R package installed: Use install_github() install {chart} package GitHub (source main branch recompiled machine): R install required dependencies automatically, compile install {chart}.

title: Unified Interface (with Formula) for R Plots
text: Starting airquality {datasets}, can annotate dataset labels units variable like : first {chart}:  notice syntax relatively close {ggplot2}, except ggplot() replaced chart() aes(x = Solar.R, y = Ozone, col = Temp) replaced formula using y ~ x plus optional series %<arg>% terms <arg> argument use {ggplot2}’s aes() instruction (aes() form also accepted chart()). default style also different closer “publication-ready” version plot. Finally, labels units defined airquality dataset automatically used. course, can override labels labs() want. chart() compatible {ggplot2} ggplot2 extensions. can also used create {lattice} base R plots. Several specialized plots available chart() methods types separate packages, {modelit} {exploreit}. details, see https://www.sciviews.org/chart/. can get help package way:
code: data(airquality, package = "datasets") airquality <- data.io::labelise(airquality, label = list(   Ozone = "Ozone", Temp = "Temperature", Solar.R = "Solar radiation",   Wind = "Wind speed" ), units = list(   Ozone = "ppb", Temp = "°F", Solar.R = "lang", Wind = "mph" )) library(chart) chart(airquality, Ozone ~ Solar.R %col=% Temp) +   geom_point(na.rm = TRUE) library(help = "chart") help("chart-package") vignette("chart") # Not installed with install_github()

title: Unified Interface (with Formula) for R Plots
text: Please note {chart} package released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

text: set Sgg used like : Sgg$geom_point(). transforms fly original ggplot2 function supposed used + operator (like p + geom_point()) pipeable version (like p %>% Sgg$geom_point()).

code: Sgg(ggplot, ...)  # S3 method for subsettable_Sgg $(x, name)  # S3 method for subsettable_Sgg .DollarNames(x, pattern = "")

title: Make a ggplot function pipeable — Sgg
text: ggplot object class "ggplot" ("theme"). ... arguments passed ggplot function (see Details). x Sgg()function. name name ggplot function make pipeable. pattern regular expression list matching names.

title: Make a ggplot function pipeable — Sgg
text: Sgg() function just returns error message. subsetted name ggplot2 function (e.g., Sgg$geom_point()), returns modified version function way can used pipe operator.

title: Make a ggplot function pipeable — Sgg
text: function returned Sgg$fun modified version function fun first argument ggplot = added, instruction ggplot + ... added body. message also added body explicitly warn changes. arguments fun remain valid keep original meaning. changes done fly, original function fun altered anywhere else (particular, alteration done package namespace). using construct, make sure : (1) understand done, (2) aware use altered version original function, (3) bug strange behavior may occur due patch original author function responsible case (problem must reported author Sgg maintainer present package instead), (4) patched function exhibits additional argument behaves differently described help page original, non-patched, function!

title: Make a ggplot function pipeable — Sgg
code: library(ggplot2) data(iris) ggplot(aes(x = Petal.Length, y = Sepal.Length, col = Species) , data = iris) |>   Sgg$geom_point() |>   Sgg$labs(x = "Sepal length (mm)", y = "Petal length (mm)")  # Also try completion with Sgg$<tab>

what: Unified Interface (with Formula) for R Plots — chart-package
title: Unified Interface (with Formula) for R Plots — chart-package
text: Unification base plots, lattice ggplot2, providing single interface three plot engines.

title: Unified Interface (with Formula) for R Plots — chart-package
text: chart() constructs Chart object. combine_charts() combines multiple Chart objects single plot. f_aes() creates formula aesthetics mapping (use instead ggplot2::aes().

title: Create charts — chart
text: chart() provides unified interface base plots, lattice ggplot2.

title: Create charts — chart
code: chart(data, ..., type = NULL, env = parent.frame())  # S3 method for default chart(   data,   specif = NULL,   formula = NULL,   mapping = NULL,   ...,   type = NULL,   auto.labs = TRUE,   env = parent.frame() )  # S3 method for `function` chart(data, ..., type = NULL, auto.labs = TRUE, env = parent.frame())  # S3 method for subsettable_type $(x, name)

title: Create charts — chart
text: data dataset (data.frame tibble, usually). ... arguments. type type plot produce. env environment evaluated formula. specif Specification, either aes(), formula. formula formula. mapping aes() object, ggplot(). auto.labs labels (units) automatically used axes? x subsettable_type function. name value use type= argument.

title: Create charts — chart
code: urchin <- data.io::read("urchin_bio", package = "data.io", lang = "en")  # base R graphics hist(urchin$height)  # ... translates to: chart(function() hist(urchin$height))  # ... or if the expression is provided directly, specify it is a base chart chart(hist(urchin$height), type = "base")   # ... or more concisely: chart$base(hist(urchin$height)) #> Error in chart.default(type = name, ...): It seems no plot was generated with this code  # A lattice plot histogram(~ height, data = urchin) chart$histogram(urchin, ~ height)  # ggplot2 histogram ggplot(urchin, aes(height)) + geom_histogram() #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`. #... or with chart (notice similarities with lattice version) chart(urchin,  ~ height) + geom_histogram() #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`. #chart$geom_histogram(urchin,  ~ height)

title: Select chart theme — chart_theme
text: Lattice ggplot2 provide themes plots, base R plots, one specifies appearance par(). chart_theme() tries get plot appearance uniform possible three plot engines. , setting themes way change appearance three kinds plots.

title: Select chart theme — chart_theme
code: chart_theme(theme)  theme_sciviews(font_size = 12, font_family = "", line_size = 0.5)  theme_sciviews_lattice(...)  theme_sciviews_graphics(...)  theme_svgray()  theme_svgray_lattice(...)  theme_svgray_graphics()  theme_svmap()  theme_svmap_lattice()  theme_svmap_graphics()

title: Select chart theme — chart_theme
text: theme theme apply (character string). font_size default size font theme. font_family default font family theme. line_size default line size theme. ... Arguments passed ggplot2like(), used n= number colors generate palette.

title: Combine charts — combine_charts
text: Assemble multiple charts page. Wrapper around ggarrange() different defaults.

title: Combine charts — combine_charts
code: combine_charts(chartlist, ncol = NULL, nrow = NULL, labels = "AUTO", ...)

title: Combine charts — combine_charts
text: chartlist List charts combine. ncol (optional) number columns plot grid. nrow (optional) number rows plot grid. labels (optional) labels use individual plot. "AUTO" ... arguments passed ggarrange(). (default value) auto-generates uppercase labels, "auto" lowercase labels.

title: Combine charts — combine_charts
text: object class ggarrange containing list ggplots.

title: chart 1.5.2
text: Documentation (vignettes README file) completed. License change MIT better reusability.

title: chart 1.5.1
text: Sgg() now prefers using Sgg$ggtitle(), Sgg$title() accepted well.

title: chart 1.5.0
text: gg() subsettable function now called Sgg() implements svMisc:aka() svMisc::section() sort items different sections.

title: chart 1.4.0
text: gg() subsettable function allows use pipe instead + ggplot2, like ggplot() |> gg$geom_point(). Also, completion list available typing gg$<tab>.

title: chart 1.3.1
text: Code chart.default() choked R CMD Check (variable y defined scope) commented . Expect slightly different behavior automatic geom_point() one variable. GitHub repository cleaned (spelling + GitHub actions added).

title: chart 1.3.1
text: Two bugs chart.default() appeared ggplot 3.0 solved. ggplot2 3.0 viridis palettes needed thus eliminated.
